talk.author: did:plc:n52kyrbfdqtmgu5zhh2bmx55
talk.utter:
No. Blue. Checks.

We already have labelers that can be used for this purpose. We don’t need to immediately capitulate to an influx of people from another website.

Brands and celebrities can learn how to use their established domains here. Please don’t go down the Twitter route here…

talk.author: did:plc:rxe56c6rcyldnr7xhprpsgud
talk.utter: That doesn't always work though and not all have their own domains

talk.author: did:plc:n52kyrbfdqtmgu5zhh2bmx55
talk.utter:
Anyone can setup their own domain. It does, indeed, always work.

If you’re large enough to have a following, you likely have an agent and a website. You also likely have a web of other socials to self-validate yourself.

I’m a nobody, and I setup a domain. It’s trivially simple.

There are reasons why a domain may not work

talk.author: did:plc:n52kyrbfdqtmgu5zhh2bmx55
talk.utter:
How would a blue checkmark that advertises exactly who they are to the entire internet be a better alternative?

I don’t think Bluesky is a good medium for that specific case. PGP key exchange with an anonymous, but verified individual is a better fit. That, or Signal I guess.

talk.author: did:plc:5ndfxputddxdqgcjha6yph57
talk.utter: Not everyone wants to and clearly Bluesky wants to grow so why are you complaining that they might do something that does just that?

talk.author: did:plc:n52kyrbfdqtmgu5zhh2bmx55
talk.utter:
Rebuilding Twitter is not a path to success. Everyone who has tried has failed. Even Facebook can’t get this right.

Blue checks will inevitably lead to the same incentives that prioritized “content” over community, and they are wholly unnecessary. We already have labelers and domain handles.
